sn2.9:1.2: Now at that time the Moon God had been seized by Rāhu, lord of titans.
sn2.9:1.3: Then the Moon God, recollecting the Buddha, at that time recited this verse:
sn2.9:3.1: Then the Buddha addressed Rāhu in verse concerning the Moon God:
sn2.9:4.1: “The Moon God has gone for refuge
sn2.9:4.2: to the Realized One, the perfected one.
sn2.9:4.3: The Buddhas have compassion for the world—
sn2.9:5.1: Then Rāhu, having released the Moon, rushed to see Vepacitti, lord of titans and stood to one side, shocked and awestruck.
sn2.9:6.3: and came here looking like you’re in shock:
sn2.9:6.4: why do you stand there so scared?”
sn2.9:7.1: “My head would have exploded in seven pieces,
sn2.9:7.2: I would have found no happiness in life,
sn2.9:7.3: if, when enchanted by the Buddha’s spell,
sn2.9:7.4: I had not released the Moon.”
